definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
adopted son (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)

sentences.english: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
sentences.chinese: 比拉死了，波斯拉人謝拉的兒子約巴接續他作王。

sentences.english: She put the medicine on the top shelf beyond the reach of her son .
sentences.chinese: 她把藥放在了兒子夠不着的最上面的架子上。

sentences.english: Without experiences in mind, he pledged he would never let his own two-year old son face such difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他發誓不會讓自己兩歲的兒子生活得那麼艱辛。

sentences.english: Rachel watches Ben while Ross has a meeting, and she teaches him all about practical jokes.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯開會，瑞秋替他照看兒子班並教他惡作劇。

sentences.english: She sat only in the boy's room.
sentences.chinese: 她一個人獨坐在兒子的房間裏。

sentences.english: And the children of Amram； Aaron， and Moses， and Miriam.
sentences.chinese: 暗蘭的兒子是亞倫，摩西，還有女兒米利暗。

sentences.english: Suddenly the hero's son picked up a knife and killed the dragon.
sentences.chinese: 突然英雄的兒子拿起刀殺了龍。

sentences.english: And Manasseh his son succeeded him as king.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子瑪拿西接續他作王。

sentences.english: Mary intended to acknowledge him as her son.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗有意認他做自己的兒子。

sentences.english: Marie-Thérèse was also the mother of his son Claude, and his daughter Paloma.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗後來又生了兒子克勞德和女兒帕露瑪。

sentences.english: Upon Duke Ning's death, his son Jia Daihua succeeded him on the official position.
sentences.chinese: 寧公死後，賈代化襲了官，也養了兩個兒子。

sentences.english: If his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
sentences.chinese: 誰有兒子求餅，反給他石頭呢？

sentences.english: An old farmer called his sons to his bedside to read them his will.
sentences.chinese: 一個老農夫把兒子們叫到牀前，向他們宣讀遺囑。

sentences.english: Son and daughter-indemnities to sell the house.
sentences.chinese: 兒子和媳婦認賠賣掉房子。

sentences.english: Mrs. Castle was invariably standing there on the porch waiting for her son.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯爾夫人總是站在門廊上等兒子。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝賀我的鄰居，他的兒子剛剛贏得選舉。

definition: Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
